Unfortunately, it’s too late to fix that - that ship has sailed ðŸ˜¬ We can, however, make sure our kids learn about money. item.title: Varsity personal finance course on iGOT Karmayogi portal
item.description: In some exciting news, @zerodhavarsity’s personal finance course is now available on the IGOT (@iGOTKarmayogi) portal for government employees. It’s easy to think that most people should and will know the importance of saving, having an emergency fund, health insurance, long-term investing, etc., but that’s not the case. I’m hoping as many people as possible watch this and learn the basics. By the way, this is available on the Varsity website and YouTube channel as well.

item.title: 10 Years of Zerodha Varsity
item.description: Itâ€™s been 10 years since we started Varsity. What began as a simple blog has gradually grown into a full-fledged stock market education initiative. Today, Varsity spans text, video, audio, and our latest additionâ€”a live format called Varsity Live. Itâ€™s an interactive, live education program and the first of its kind. When we started, Karthik Rangappa and I decided that Varsity would have no agenda. There would be no pitching of Zerodha to Varsity users, no mandatory login, or anything else.

item.title: Update on all our educational content initiatives
item.description: Some people, jokingly perhaps, say, “Zerodha is a content company.” But this isn’t something we are doing now. We’ve been sharing everything we know about finance, markets, and investing since day 1 of Zerodha in text formâ€”even before “content” was a thing. In fact, Z-Connect is one of the oldest finance blogs in India. It’s just that now we are publishing a lot more video content across @ZerodhaVarsity, @zerodhamarkets, @zerodhaonline, @Rainmatterin, Zero1 and there’s @nikhilkamathcio’s WTF and @kmr_dilip’s The Other Side as well.

item.title: Interactive learning with Varsity Live
item.description: We started @ZerodhaVarsity almost a decade ago to simplify how the stock market worked in English and Hindi for free. For people who preferred video, we turned all the modules into video. Today, Varsity is easily one of the most read and watched resources for all things financial markets. But until now it was self-directedâ€”you had to read, watch, and then learn about things. We had always wanted to introduce an interactive mode of learning about markets, and we finally got around to launching Varsity Live in collaboration with @LearnappHQ.

item.title: Introducing Varsity Live
item.description: If you want to learn anything about trading, investing, and personal finance, I don’t think there’s a better place than @ZerodhaVarsity. The idea of Varsity began with a random email I sent to @karthikrangappa in 2014, and today, it’s one of the most popular free and open resources for all things stock markets, not just in India but maybe globally. The website has over 15 comprehensive modules and gets millions of hits.

item.title: Letters from Warren Buffett
item.description: Warren Buffett and Charlie Munger are arguably the greatest investors ever. Their track record over 50â€“60 years is just insane. Warren Buffett has been writing letters to shareholders since 1965. These letters contain a wealth of wisdom, not just for stockpickers but for all investors as well. If you don’t have the time to read all the letters, we’re starting a new series on Varsity to summarize all the letters. Check out the first episode, in which the team discusses the first 5 letters.

item.title: Financial Literacy for Rural Women-A film by Zerodha Varsity
item.description: For India to do well, people must know how to manage their moneyâ€”not just in metros but in smaller towns and villages. One way to ensure people in smaller towns learn a little about money is to teach people there. People naturally share knowledge given the closer bonds there, especially among women. So @karthikrangappa, through our education initiative, @ZerodhaVarsity ran a two-day workshop in a small town called Chikkodi near the Karnataka-Mahrashtra border in association with Pankh India and Svatah.

item.title: Introducing Varsity Certified
item.description: India can only do well if people are financially literate, & knowing about money is also a life skill. This is why we started @ZerodhaVarsity. The best time to learn is before people learn the wrong things. Why we are excited about Varsity certification.
